intro: Alchornea liukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu alchorneas, is a flowering plant species native to the Ryukyu Islands in Japan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Alchornea liukiuensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest for botanists studying tropical plant species.
